name: Logged in as a Neuven User
testScript:
• Select Agency
  • List of workers displayed
  • Documents – View
  • Window displaying a list of default documents and client-specific documents based on the clients the agency selected is linked to, with upload details displayed
  • There are no changes to this view – except the list of documents shown will dynamically change based on agency–client linking and the documents specified for the clients (that agency is linked to) in the documents maintenance page.
  • Also add a new column Mandatory and show whether the document type was specified as mandatory in the documents maintenance page
justification: Tests a critical business process (document management), covers multiple components (login, navigation, permissions), involves dynamic content based on different conditions, and has security implications.

name: Worker document maintenance page access
testScript:
• Page will be seen in the Administration tab in Nav Menu

  • Page will be accessed by Neuven users (Venneu) and have Admin permissions.
justification: Involves multi-role permission checks, critical business functionality (document access), and security implications.

name: Verify that as a client user when exporting a timesheet the new columns are added.
folder: Uno-1927 - Client User - Timesheets Page - Export Timesheets - please add columns
testScript:
Given:
  • Logged in as as Client User 
When:
  • On the time sheets > enter/view timesheets page.
Then:
  • Create a time sheets and click save.
  • Select the timesheet
  • Click the export button
  • The “Created By”, “Created Date/Time” “Approved By”, “Approved Date/Time and “Authorised By”, “Authorised Date/Time”   columns should be added to the report.
justification: Critical business functionality related to timesheet export, involves multi-role permissions, and covers data integrity and proper column display.

name: Verify that when logged in as a client with approve timesheet permissions , i am able to approve timesheets.
folder: Uno-1927 - Client User - Timesheets Page - Export Timesheets - please add columns
testScript:
Given :
  • Logged in as a client with the approve timesheets permission.
When :
  • On the time sheets > create / view time sheets page.
Then :
  • Approve a time sheet,
  • Click the export button and the new columns “Created By”, “Created Date/Time” “Approved By”, “Approved Date/Time   should be populated.
justification: Critical business functionality related to timesheet approval, involves multi-role permissions, and covers data integrity and proper timestamp functionality.

name: Verify that when logged in as a client with authorization  timesheet  permissions , I am able to authorize timesheets.
folder: Uno-1927 - Client User - Timesheets Page - Export Timesheets - please add columns
testScript:
Given :
  • Logged in as a client with the authorize timesheets permission.
When :
  • On the time sheets > create / view time sheets page.
Then :
  • Authorize a time sheet,
  • Click the export button and the new columns “Created By”, “Created Date/Time” “Approved By”, “Approved Date/Time  , and “Authorised By”, “Authorised Date/Time”  should be populated.
justification: Critical business functionality related to timesheet authorization, involves multi-role permissions, and covers data integrity and proper timestamp functionality.

name: Verify that as a Client user  in T&A the hours are calculated correctly.
testScript:
Given:
  • Logged in as a Client User. 
When :
  • On the T&A screen
Then:
  • Create a new time and attendance
  • Add a break for this time and attendance of 1 hour .
  • Add another shift in this time and attendance that starts late and carries ove to the next day, - to carry it over click the is night button on the line.
  • Following this.
  • Add another break for the shift that has carried over.
  • Verify all lines.
  • Check that the Paid and unpaid time has been calculated correctly. 
  • Check a time sheet has been created.
justification: Critical functionality related to time and attendance (core business process), involves calculations, and ensures data integrity.

name: Verify that as a Client User - I can create a normal shift and add a break to it and the hours calculate correctly.
testScript:
Given:
  • Logged in as a Client User. 
When :
  • On the T&A screen
Then:
  • Create a new time and attendance
  • Add a break for this time and attendance of 1 hour .
  • Verify all lines.
  • Check that the Paid and unpaid time has been calculated correctly. 
  • Check a time sheet has been created.
justification: Critical functionality related to time and attendance (core business process), involves calculations, and ensures data integrity.

name: UNO2072  , UNO 2074 Verify the Authorization Step Addition
testScript:

  • Logged in as user with 'approve booking' permissions, 
When :

Then :
  • The booking need to be authorized before it can be sent to the client .
justification: This test covers the critical flow of authorization steps in booking approval. It ensures that bookings go through proper authorization before client release, involving permissions and multiple user roles.

justification: Tests critical business process (data visibility), covers multiple integrated components (user roles and data filtering), verifies security-related functionality, and involves different user permissions.

name: Verify changes to Worker documents page when logged in as a CLIENT user (general)
testScript:
Given : 

  • Logged in as a client user with View Documents permission

When :

  • Click Documents - View Worker documents

Then
  • Select  and agency from the drop down. 
  • Verify that the following columns have been added to the page. Compliant , Induction Date Column  and ACTION .
justification: Verifies critical business functionality, involves multiple components, and has security implications related to document management and compliance.

name: Verify changes to Worker documents page when logged in as a CLIENT user (Compliant)
testScript:
Given : 
  • Logged in as a client user with View Documents permission
When :
  • Click Documents - View Worker documents
Then

  • A green tick is shown if all the mandatory documents based on the job type group for the client and default documents set for Venneu are uploaded by the agency

  •  A red 'x' is shown if one or more mandatory documents are not uploaded or if any of the uploaded mandatory documents have expired
justification: Covers critical compliance and document management aspects, involves security-related checks (document status), and tests business-critical processes. High business impact.

name: Verify changes to Worker documents page when logged in as a CLIENT user (Action Column)
testScript:
Given : 
  • Logged in as a client user with View Documents permission
When :
  • Click Documents - View Worker documents
Then :

  • Action column to include an Approval tick box

    • A tick box with blue-tick shows if the worker was previously approved to work for the client in this page or in shift fulfilment page.

    • Empty tick box shown if the worker was not approved previously

    • This tick box is visible only for users with ‘Approve workers for shift’ permission and is also editable only by users with that permission
justification: Verifies functionality with high security implications (approval process), involves multiple components and user roles, and is a critical business process.

name: Verify as a NEUVEN user the options for EDITING a direct bank worker - compliance tab passport details section
testScript:
Given:
  • Logged in as a Neuven user (With Manage Direct Bank Workers Permission)
When:
  • Direct Bank Worker page
  • When editing a Direct Bank Worker 
Then:
  • On the Compliance Tab
  • Passport details
    • Toggle – can only be seen if the user has the Manage Direct Bank Workers Permission
  • Passport expiry date field – helper text to show correct DD/MM/YYYY format, and also include a calendar function (date picker)

name: Verify as a NEUVEN user that the DBS function pulls information correctly from the API.
testScript:
Given :

  • Logged in as a Neuven user with ‘Manage Direct Bank worker Permission'

When :

  • Click Add New Direct Bank worker

  • Compliance Tab

Then :

  • On the compliance tab there is a ‘Check DBS Number’ Button -

  • When this is clicked a Pop up Opens - DBS Details

  • The pop up contains the following fieilds

    • DBS Number (Pre-filled with information in the compliance tab)

    • Surname (Null)

    • Forename (Null)

    • Status (Null)

    • Print Date (Null) 

    • Check DBS Number Button

  • When the DBS Check button clicked

  • An API call is made to DBS website

  • Status of User is returned and all the fields are filled
    This screen then closes and the user can then close the main popup screen
justification: API integration test ensuring that data is correctly pulled and displayed. This test is critical as it covers data retrieval and validation from third-party services, impacting compliance and user information accuracy.

name: Verify the NEUVEN user the Approving Bank Workers page layout
testScript:

When

Then

  • Worker Profile column

name: Add Employee Documents Page
testScript:
Page to contain
  •   Please upload scanned copies of below documents:
  • Select document type dropdown
    • Dropdown to load with all the default documents set in the documents administration page
    • Dropdown to also include client-specific documents set in the documents administration page - for the clients the agency is linked to.
  • Expiry Date
    • Date picker to choose a date
    • Not a mandatory field
    • Allow Null entries (Expiry date is irrelevant for some document types)
  •  Drop or click to upload documents here
    • Dropbox for documents
    • Specify the allowed formats and size of the document at the bottom of the Dropbox as shown on the mockup
    • Allow drag and drop or click through to choose documents to upload
  • Upload button
    • Click
    • The document is uploaded and shown in the table below
justification: Covers core document management functionality, includes data integrity checks, and is vital for system operations.

name: Error Messages
testScript:
• Upload clicked without choosing document type ‘please select document type’ displayed.
  • Upload clicked with a document that does not match with the specified formats ‘document filetype not supported’ is displayed
  • Upload clicked with a document that exceeds the specified size ‘File too large for upload’ displayed
  • Upload clicked without a document in the drop box ‘Please choose a file to upload’ is displayed
  • Upload clicked with a document type that already exists on the table ‘Document already exist – Do you want to replace the existing document’ displayed in a pop-up window
    • Yes Button
      • Clicked - Document replaced – window closed
    • No Button
      • Clicked – window closed
justification: Ensures robust input validation, essential for avoiding data corruption, and involves multiple types of user interactions.

name: Existing Employee Documents table - Settings
testScript:
• Table to have a search box at the top
  • Table to have pagination at the bottom
  • Page numbers to be clickable, and arrows to move forward and backward by the user
  • Table to have select page size drop-down at the bottom with 10,20,50 and 100 options
  • When page size is selected table should show the appropriate number of rows based on the selection
  • The bottom of the table shows the total number of items on current pages vs the overall total number of items (EG Showing 10 of 100 entries), in the right corner
justification: Verifies table settings and data pagination, crucial for data management and usability in employee document management.

name: Existing Employee Documents table
testScript:
Table columns
  • Document type
    • Document type selected when uploading is displayed
  • Document Name
    • Document File Name is displayed
  • Expiry Date
    • Expiry date selected when uploading is displayed
  • Uploaded On
    • Display date document was uploaded
  • Action
    • Delete icon displayed
      • Clicked – ‘Are you sure you want to delete the document’ displayed in a pop-up window
      • Yes Button
        • Clicked – Document Deleted– window closed
      • No Button
        • Clicked – window closed
justification: Ensures visibility and correct data representation of existing documents, which is vital for employee document integrity.
